result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

03:03 PM  Defendant Kenneth Crawford in court in custody appearing by video  with attorney Jason D Sanders appearing by video with legal intern Olivia Long also appearing by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $2500.00   with conditions. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of weapons. Curfew 6pm-6am unless at work or driving directly to and from work. No intentional contact with Co Defendants Laurice Crawford or Rasheen Jackson. Preliminary hearing May 23, 2022 at 2:30 pm.
